text: people are concerned about pesticide safety they've heard stories about people getting cancers or other illnesses due to the pesticide exposure and so we're gonna talk a little bit about the time in which people get exposed to those chemicals most often that is going to be during the mixing and loading portion of your pesticide application one of the things we take a look at is that are you using your personal protective equipment many of the labels are actually most of the labels are going to tell you what personal protective equipment is required if it's going to be chemical resistant gloves if it's gonna be goggles or a face mask or maybe it's that you wear long sleeve shirts or maybe in this particular case a Tyvek suit when you're making certain applications within your pesticide and program so mixing and loading why is it so dangerous it's like most of us can understand the concept if we stick the hose into a spray tank that there's water that's going to go into the tank where we see most of the problem is though as we take our chemical we mix it we measure it and then I will suddenly want to watch it go into a spray tank and then we get splashed back into our eyes unto our face and we have very high concentrations of chemical to get on to our body so you need to have the personal protective equipment on to protect yourself from those exposures also in mixing and loading we want to make sure that you're going to do things correctly North Dakota like many states puts out a weed control guy there's actually a formula on page 96 that will tell you which of the products goes in first and so apples is the formula that we use in agitate then you put the different chemicals and add to the into the spray-paint in a particular order when we go out we start spraying you have to realize that even though it chemical might be a restrictive use which is bidipi seen on the front of the label right by the label made these chemicals are going to be more dangerous because they're more persistent however that does not mean the general use of pesticides don't come with the gun with risk many of us had the conversation about glyphosate is it dangerous or is it not dangerous so we are going to try to teach you here is that it is your responsibility if you haven't received a pesticide license you're basically saying that you are going to read and follow the label many Extension agents are people that have taught pesticide classes emphasize that the label is the law and it's something that you have to do as an individual producer or applicator is to read it again I wish we would talk more with the general applicators as well because the big story is about glyphosate which is not restricted use but there is still still potential risk with it and it's because people don't read the label the chemical companies has spent millions of dollars to figure out how to keep the applicators safe during those chemical applications and now it's your job to read and follow the label like good applicators would
